issue.title: discord.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://discord.com/channels/234492134806257665/234724393568174080](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdiscord.com%2Fchannels%2F234492134806257665%2F234724393568174080) ### Comment > Blocking `https://discord.com/api/v9/science` causes high ram and battery usage because discord will keep attempting to send the query every 0.5 second if it detects faliure. Adguard should do what uBlock Origin did and make a script rule instead. > > https://github.com/FONZACUS/uAssets/commit/0d7b679cbb7fb91b57eceecd297cf72d6c59832c ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/qvek5if1upwgc4wo0oc448o040gkoggt0idb9sfazk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/4o5xwwaauxa84ws4s4kgkk044g0oc0g79ic95p63u0.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.500.10 MV3 System version: | `Linux x86_64` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Filters last update: | December 09, 2025 at 19:00 ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.2.500.10&system_version=Linux+x86_64&manifest_version=3&browser=chrome&filters=2.3&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false&filters_last_update=2025-12-09T19%3A00%3A42)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: discord.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://discord.com/channels/234492134806257665/234724393568174080](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdiscord.com%2Fchannels%2F234492134806257665%2F234724393568174080) ### Comment > Blocking `https://discord.com/api/v9/science` causes high ram and battery usage because discord will keep attempting to send the query every 0.5 second if it detects faliure. Adguard should do what uBlock Origin did and make a script rule instead. > > https://github.com/FONZACUS/uAssets/commit/0d7b679cbb7fb91b57eceecd297cf72d6c59832c ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/qvek5if1upwgc4wo0oc448o040gkoggt0idb9sfazk.png?nc=1)

issue.title: discord.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://discord.com/channels/234492134806257665/234724393568174080](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdiscord.com%2Fchannels%2F234492134806257665%2F234724393568174080) ### Comment > Blocking `https://discord.com/api/v9/science` causes high ram and battery usage because discord will keep attempting to send the query every 0.5 second if it detects faliure. Adguard should do what uBlock Origin did and make a script rule instead. > > https://github.com/FONZACUS/uAssets/commit/0d7b679cbb7fb91b57eceecd297cf72d6c59832c ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/qvek5if1upwgc4wo0oc448o040gkoggt0idb9sfazk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/4o5xwwaauxa84ws4s4kgkk044g0oc0g79ic95p63u0.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.500.10 MV3 System version: | `Linux x86_64` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
